title: Southern Pecan Pie II
description: Experience the rich, buttery goodness of this classic Southern pecan pie, a timeless dessert that boasts a perfectly flaky crust and a luscious, nutty filling. This pie is not only a feast for the taste buds but also a beautiful centerpiece for any holiday or special occasion.
ingredients: ½ cup butter, chilled and diced
instructions: In a large bowl, combine 1 ½ cups flour, 3 tablespoons sugar, and salt.
Cut in the chilled butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
Mix the egg yolk with ice water and stir into the flour mixture until it forms a ball.
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
Roll out the dough and place it in a 9-inch pie plate.
Place pecan halves evenly in the bottom of the pie crust.
In a large bowl, stir together ¾ cup sugar and 2 tablespoons flour.
Mix in eggs, corn syrup, milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract until well blended.
Pour the filling over the pecans in the crust.
Bake in the preheated oven for 10 minutes.
Reduce oven temperature to 350°F (175°C) and bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until the filling is set and golden brown.
Allow the pie to cool completely before serving to let the filling set perfectly.
tips: For a flaky crust, keep your butter cold and handle the dough as little as possible. To check doneness, the filling should be set but slightly jiggly in the center. Avoid overbaking to prevent a dry filling. Let the pie cool fully to enhance flavor and texture.

structured_content.content: This Southern Pecan Pie II is a celebration of rich, nutty flavors and a buttery, flaky crust that melts in your mouth. The glossy, caramel-like filling studded with pecan halves creates a stunning visual and a delightful texture that makes every bite unforgettable.

structured_content.content: I first tasted this pie at a family reunion, where my friend Joyce shared the recipe passed down from a wise Southern lady. Every bite brought back warm memories of Southern hospitality and festive celebrations, making it a treasured recipe in my kitchen.

• Main ingredient: Fresh pecan halves provide a crunchy texture and rich flavor essential to this pie. Choose high-quality pecans for the best taste.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Vanilla extract enhances the sweetness and depth of the filling, while a pinch of salt balances flavors.
  • Supporting ingredients: Butter and eggs create a tender crust and creamy filling, while corn syrup adds the signature glossy sweetness.
  • Equipment needed: Mixing bowls, pastry cutter or fork, rolling pin, 9-inch pie plate, and an oven are essential for perfect results.

Preparation:
Combine dry ingredients and cut in cold butter until crumbly. Add egg yolk mixed with ice water to form dough. Chill dough for at least 1 hour to ensure a flaky crust.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Roll out dough and line pie plate. Arrange pecans evenly. Mix filling ingredients thoroughly and pour over pecans. Bake first at high heat to set crust, then reduce temperature to cook filling through without burning.
Finishing Touches:
Cool pie completely on a wire rack to allow filling to set. Serve at room temperature or slightly warm for best flavor and texture.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Start baking at a high temperature to set the crust quickly and prevent sogginess.
  • Avoid overmixing the dough to keep the crust tender and flaky.
  • The filling is ready when it is golden brown and slightly jiggly in the center.
  • Store leftovers covered at room temperature for up to 2 days or refrigerate for up to 5 days; reheat gently before serving.

structured_content.content: This pie has been a centerpiece at many family gatherings, bringing everyone together to share stories and laughter over a slice of sweet, nutty goodness. It’s more than a dessert; it’s a tradition that warms the heart.

Enhance the pie by adding a pinch of cinnamon or a splash of bourbon to the filling for a warm, spiced twist. Toasting the pecans lightly before baking deepens their flavor and adds extra crunch. A sprinkle of sea salt on top before baking creates a delightful sweet-salty contrast.

Serve this pecan pie with a dollop of whipped cream or a scoop of vanilla ice cream for a classic pairing. Complement with strong coffee or a glass of bourbon for an indulgent treat. Perfect for holiday dinners, potlucks, or cozy autumn evenings.

For a gluten-free version, substitute the all-purpose flour with a gluten-free blend. Vegan adaptations can use coconut oil instead of butter and flax eggs in place of eggs. Try adding chocolate chips or swapping pecans for walnuts for a unique twist that keeps the spirit of the original pie.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Use chilled butter and ice water to achieve a flaky, tender crust.
  • Mix filling ingredients just until combined to avoid a tough texture.
  • Start baking at 450°F to set the crust, then lower to 350°F to finish cooking the filling evenly.
  • Brush the crust edges with egg wash for a glossy, golden finish.

structured_content.content: With this Southern Pecan Pie II recipe, you’re equipped to create a dessert that’s both stunning and delicious. Enjoy the process, savor the flavors, and share the joy of baking a true Southern classic with your loved ones.
